checks.name: Replication Factor vs Broker Count
checks.message: All topics have appropriate replication factor (≤ 1 brokers)
checks.description: Checks if any topic has a replication factor greater than the number of brokers. Healthy: All topics have RF ≤ broker count. Failed: Any topic has RF > broker count.

checks.name: Topic Partition Distribution
checks.message: Good partition distribution: avg=1.0, min=1, max=1
checks.description: Checks if user topics have a balanced number of partitions. Healthy: Partition counts are similar. Warning: Large difference between min and max partitions.

checks.name: Consumer Group Health
checks.message: 1 consumer group(s) have no active members: perf-test-group
checks.recommendation: Consider cleaning up unused consumer groups
checks.description: Checks if all consumer groups have active members. Healthy: All groups have members. Warning: Some groups have no active members.

checks.name: Internal Topics Health
checks.description: Checks if all internal topics (names starting with __) have partitions > 0. Healthy: All internal topics have partitions. Failed: Any internal topic has 0 or missing partitions.

checks.name: Under-Replicated Partitions
checks.message: All topics have the expected number of in-sync replicas

checks.name: Min In-Sync Replicas Configuration
checks.message: All topics have appropriate min.insync.replicas configuration

checks.name: Rack Awareness
checks.message: Rack awareness is not configured - no brokers have rack information
checks.recommendation: Consider enabling rack awareness for better availability and fault tolerance
checks.description: Checks if rack awareness is configured in the cluster. Healthy: Rack awareness is configured. Warning: Rack awareness is not configured.

checks.name: Replica Distribution
checks.message: Perfect replica balance: Each broker carries 51.0 replicas on average (range: 51-51)
checks.description: Checks if data replicas are evenly distributed across all brokers. Healthy: Each broker carries a similar number of replicas. Warning/Failed: Some brokers carry significantly more replicas than others, which can cause performance issues.

checks.name: Metrics Configuration
checks.message: No JMX metrics configuration detected on any brokers
checks.recommendation: Enable JMX metrics on brokers for better monitoring, alerting, and performance analysis
checks.description: Checks if monitoring metrics are properly configured. For AWS MSK: Checks Open Monitoring with Prometheus JMX exporter. For others: Checks JMX metrics configuration. Healthy: Metrics are enabled and accessible. Warning: Metrics are not configured or partially configured.

checks.name: Generic Kafka Logging Configuration
checks.recommendation: Verify log4j configuration and log directory permissions in server.properties
checks.description: Checks if logging configuration is properly configured. For AWS MSK: Checks LoggingInfo configuration and CloudTrail. For Confluent Cloud/Aiven: Built-in logging is available. For others: Checks log4j configuration. Healthy: Logging is enabled and configured. Warning: Logging is not configured or partially configured.

checks.name: Generic Kafka Authentication Configuration
checks.message: Unauthenticated access is enabled - this is a security risk
checks.recommendation: Enable SASL or SSL authentication in server.properties for better security
checks.description: Checks if unauthenticated access is enabled. For AWS MSK: Checks if SASL or SSL is configured. For Confluent Cloud/Aiven: Built-in authentication prevents unauthenticated access. For others: Checks if SASL or SSL is configured. Healthy: Authentication is enabled (no unauthenticated access). Failed: Unauthenticated access is enabled (security risk).

checks.name: Generic Kafka Quotas Configuration
checks.message: No quota configuration detected in Kafka cluster
checks.recommendation: Configure quotas in server.properties or use kafka-configs.sh to set client quotas for better resource management
checks.description: Checks if Kafka quotas are configured and being used. For AWS MSK: Checks quota configuration via AWS console/CLI. For Confluent Cloud/Aiven: Built-in quota management is available. For others: Checks server.properties and kafka-configs.sh for quota settings. Healthy: Quotas are configured and managed. Info: Quotas configuration check available.

checks.name: Payload Compression
checks.message: No compression detected on any of the 1 user topics (0%)
checks.recommendation: Enable compression on topics to reduce storage usage and improve network performance
checks.description: Checks if payload compression is enabled on user topics. Analyzes compression.type, compression, and producer.compression.type configurations. Healthy: All user topics have compression enabled (100%). Warning: Some or no topics have compression enabled (<100%). Info: No user topics to analyze.

checks.name: Infinite Retention Policy
checks.message: No topics have infinite retention policy enabled
checks.description: Checks if any topics have infinite retention policy enabled (retention.ms = infinite). Healthy: No topics have infinite retention. Warning: Some topics have infinite retention policy (bad practice). Info: Unable to verify retention policy.
